Text.Value: I feel awful. We won't be doing that again.
Fine - he stays, 'til he's no longer of use. Besides, my flesh is not so easily tasted.
A vamp, huh? Interesting. Keep your teeth to yourself, Astarion, and we won't have any issues.
What's causing this? The mind flayer's parasite?
No, but I have questions. How are you standing in the sun?
I just better not wake with any holes in my neck.
I'm just glad you're being sensible about these revelations. I was worried people might turn up with torches and pitchforks.
Enough. We need him, like it or not.
Perhaps I am. For two hundred years, the sun would have turned me to cinders. Now I stand here like it's nothing.
Good morning. How do you feel?
For his sake, he best not develop an appetite for githyanki.
Is that how you could stand in the sun? Because you're not a 'true' vampire?

EditorData.stateContext: Player & Astarion addressing the companion(s) that just spoke.

Text.Value: Oh you're such a sweetheart.

EditorData.NodeContext: verging on mocking, but not quite

Text.Value: I'd just better not wake in the night to find fangs at my throat.
My neck hurts, how do you think I feel?
You say all the right words, but I'm not so sure you mean the right things. Still, I will respect the decision that was made.
Not at all. Having a vampire on our side could be useful.
So we're travelling with a vampire, are we?
But now that the air's clear, we should probably get moving. There's a long day ahead of us.
Well. I hope there are no bad feelings.
Figure them out quickly. I don't want any more surprises.
I wouldn't recommend it. I won't get you, but the mind flayers might.

EditorData.NodeContext: To the other companion, not the PC

Text.Value: Oh, and a quick word of warning, Astarion: I taste absolutely awful. Keep your distance.
There now. We're all friends again.
As for my other quirks - well, we can figure those out in time.
Unless, of course, I have offered it.
I'm fine, I just feel a little woozy.
Yeah. And I'm way too hot to touch.
Oh no, I should be cinders in this light. I hadn't seen the sun for two hundred years before we crashed here.
Someone - or something - wants me alive. They've changed the rules.
Anyway, you'd burn your tongue off if you went for this neck.
You're lucky I didn't kill you.

EditorData.logicalname: Check more than one party member

Text.Value: That's my theory, but who knows?
I'm just glad you're being sensible about this. I was worried you might wake up and grab your torch and pitchfork.
Alas, I'm just a spawn. All of the hunger, few of the powers.
Fine - as long as he keeps his fangs off our necks.
But should I wake with so much as a drop of blood on my neck, I will end him.
And you're lucky I'm not a 'true' vampire. Last night could have gone very differently if I'd magically summoned a pack of wolves.
No more surprises. You have my word.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Astarion lays his hand on his heart.
EditorData.NodeContext: Astarion sounds sincere. He lays his hand on his heart.

Text.Value: If you don't like it, you can leave.
A word of warning, Astarion: I taste absolutely awful. Keep your distance.
Given our group's nature, I don't see much harm. We're each monsters in the making, after all.
Although there's still time.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Looks over his shoulder, realising someone's approaching
EditorData.NodeContext: Looks over his shoulder, realising someone's approaching

Text.Value: Shall we go? There's a long day ahead of us.
Be grateful I'm not a 'true' vampire, then.
A vampire? Well that explains the pallor.
Morning. I hope last night's little unpleasantness hasn't left a bad taste in your-
Very well - but I'm keeping an eye on you. And no wisecracks about having us for supper.
Vamps don't scare me. As long as they keep their teeth to themselves.
Of course, I can't summon wolves or turn to mist like a 'true' vampire. Being a spawn has its drawbacks.
Pity. I thought you'd be more powerful.
Is that how you can stand in the sun? Because you're not a 'true' vampire?
Indeed it could. These are very helpful in a fight.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: He smiles, baring his fangs, and gestures to them
EditorData.NodeContext: 'These' referring to his fangs. He smiles widely and gestures to them.

Text.Value: He's not wrong. We're bound together, no matter what comes.
She's not wrong. We're bound together, no matter what comes.
They're not wrong. We're bound together, no matter what comes.

EditorData.NodeContext: Spoken to the companion that's agressive towards you. The player defended you, and you're saying that the player isn't wrong.

Text.Value: No sense judging someone for who they are. Except devils, obviously.
A bite from them and you might wake up as a vampire spawn, like my good self. All of a vampire's hunger, but few of their powers.
Maybe we could get him to wear a bell - dissuade any night-time prowling.
A pity. Just be grateful I'm not a 'true' vampire.
Oh, I have no idea. By rights I should be cinders in this light. But someone - or something - is keeping me alive.
So we're travelling with a vampire, are we? Of course we are.
If I can help, just ask. We're in this together.
Quite the opposite. I'm here in the spirit of openness and honesty, to work together as a team.

EditorData.NodeContext: He doesn't mean it, but he's trying to sell it.

Text.Value: Any other drawbacks I should know about?
Hunting with vampires? Never thought I'd see the day.
Oh, I've no idea. For two hundred years, the sun would have turned me to cinders. Until the crash, when I woke up bathed in its light.
Some of us more than others, but - yes.
A vampire among us? So be it.
A word of warning, Astarion: I taste absolutely awful.
It'll pass. Just be glad I'm not a 'true' vampire.
I wouldn't say that. Even the most powerful vampires in history couldn't survive in the sun, but it seems I can.
No, but I have questions. How have you survived out there in the sun?
We all have our shit to bear. As long you remember your manners, Astarion, you're welcome at my fire.
Well, we all have a monster inside us of one sort or another.
Standing in the sun, wading through a river, wandering into homes without an invitation - they're all perfectly mundane activities now.
I trust him. He won't hurt us.

Synopsis: You wake up the morning after the night where Astarion (companion) tried to bite you. Depending on your choices, he might have bitten you consensually or you might have told him to piss off. He'll be wary to see if you're still in a forgiving mood. The other companions chime in with their opinions on having a vampire around, and the player defends keeping Astarion in the party.
